title: Poster, "Cloud Hands, Center for T", 1977
inscribed: Imprinted in black ink, upper right: SX
description:
Red calligraphy, right; 5 tiny white figures in silhouette on left; on black background. Imprinted in white block of text on a black ground, upper left: Cloud Hands is a center for Tai Chi, Dance / & Meditation. Initial course offerings will / be in Tai Chi Ch’uan taught for health and / meditation. Beginning students may enroll / in Part I which they should take at least / twice a week—with the option of taking all / four classes, at no additional cost. / For intermediate and advanced  students the / center will be open every weekday from 5 to / 8 pm. 5 to 6 will be an open exercise period, / from 6 to 7:30 there will be a formal class / and additional space in which students can / practice alone or in groups. Next block of text, center left: Instructors: / H. H. Lui is the director of the Tai Chi / program at Columbia College and / translator of the “Tai Chi Ch’uan / Classics.” Tem Horwitz and Susan / Kimmelman were co-founders of / MoMing. They are co-authors of Tai Chi / Ch’uan: The Technique of Power / published this year by Chicago Review / Press. Judy Chambliss, along with Tem & / Susan, is a student of H. H. Lui, and well / known Chicago calligrapher. Lower left: Term: September 12-December 17 14 Weeks / Schedule of Tai Chi: / Part I (Beginning) / Tu 6-7:30 Th 6-7:30 / M 10-12 W 10-12 / Part II / M 6-7:30 W 6-7:30 / Sat 10-12 / Part III / Fri 6-7:30 / Fees: Part I & II $90 / Part III $45 / Trial Classes $3 / Enroll at First Class Session
Lower right: Cloud Hands for Tai Chi, Dance, Meditation / 9 W. Hubbard, Chicago, Illinois 60610 / 312 644-8087 & 348-0010

tombstone.epitaph: Poster, "Cloud Hands, Center for T", 1977.Offset lithograph on paper. 1991-69-19.
